column4: whats the best cli method for determining if a particular library is installed?
dpkg -l |grep libname
if it's ii for status, it is
isnt there a distro neutral way, using a *nix utility?
find / -name libname
find / -name libname*
locate works too. usually update every day around 6am
won't that fail if I have a installer cache file named the same?
I have used (s)locate frequently
it will. to find the exact filename you need an exact name...
do you want this for a script or for a human?
just trying to determine if a library is installed to compile a program, so human
there are better ways in ubuntu: apt-get build-dep
using os x :)
then you are in the wrong channel
I figured it was a generic *nix question so I asked here :)
this channel is for ubuntu ONLY. if you want support: install ubuntu
I use ubuntu as well, so don't hate too badly
I don#t even use ubuntu. I still don't ask windows or debian questions here
point taken
it will also be a time when the number of spamzombie servers dramatically increases
ask your real question
